{{Infobox single | Name = Winter Winds | Cover = Mumfordsonswinterwinds.jpg | Artist = [[Mumford & Sons]] | Album = [[Sigh No More (Mumford & Sons album)|Sigh No More]] | B-side = | Released = 6 December 2009http://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/winter-winds-ep/id342952633 | Format = [[CD single]], [[Music download|Digital Download]] | Recorded = 2009 | Genre = [[Indie folk]], [[soul music|soul]] | Length = 3:39 | Writer = | Producer = [[Markus | Label = [[Island Records|Island]]Dravs]] | Last single = "[[Little Lion Man]]"
(2009) | This single = "'''Winter Winds'''"
(2009) | Next single = "[[The Cave (song)|The Cave]]"
(2010) | Misc = {{External music video|{{YouTube|_KCg_QEHtkY|"Winter Winds"}}}} }} "'''Winter Winds'''" is the second single by London folk quartet, [[Mumford & Sons]] released from their debut album, ''[[Sigh No More (Mumford & Sons album)|Sigh No More]]''. It was released in the [[UK]] on 6 December 2009. In the UK the single missed out on the top 40 peaking at number 44, but managed to peak to number 29 in Belgium. [[Marcus Mumford]] has said that this is his favorite song to sing live. ==Critical reception== Fraser McAlpine of the [[BBC]] Chart Blog gave the song a positive 5-star review stating that it would serve as an "amazing Christmas carol equivalent" for a 'winterval' type holiday, as "it's quietly optimistic, pleased without being smug, melancholy but uplifting" and "sure of itself, but only because all the lessons learned have been hard-won, and generally reflective of times gone by".{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/chartblog/2009/12/mumford_and_sons_winter.shtml|work=[[BBC]]|publisher=bbc.co.uk|author=Fraser McAlpine|title=Mumford & Sons - 'Winter Winds'|date=6 December 2009}} ==Music video== The video to accompany ==Track listing== *'''CD Single'''http://www.amazon.co.uk/Winter-Winds/dp/B002Z3OEXO/ref=pd_sim_dmusic_a_1 {{tracklist | title1 = Winter Winds | length1 = 3:39 | title2 = Hold On To What You Believe | length2 = 4:02 }} ==Charts== "Winter Winds" debuted on the [[UK Singles Chart]] on 30 November 2009 at number 99. The following week, the single climbed 26 places to number 73 before climbing to number 48 on 13 December 2009. The single then continued to climb, a single place to number 47 the following week; before eventually climbing to a peak of number 44 on 27 December 2009, narrowly missing out on the Top 40. The song then dropped to number 86 the week after, eventually dropping out on 24 January 2010, meaning it spent a total of 9 weeks within the Top 100. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Chart (2009) ! Peakhttp://acharts.us/song/52389
